RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 9700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 22, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 22, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRUMPELSTILTSKIN became a bit fractious in the gate then set a clear pace passing the half mile pole, came under pressure nearing the quarter, widened at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled to late stretch. GAMING JACK chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and proved no match in the lane. BUCKED TOOTH gave chase inside, rounded the turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. MEGA MILLIONS chased through the backstretch, raced four wide on the turn and showed little in the lane. SHACKLED chased, raced three wide on the turn and weakened in the lane. SCOTTY SILVER gave chase outside and raced five wide on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Grumpelstiltskin
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious in gate,clear pace,pressured 1/4,held well driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 91. Allowance Purse 36300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 22 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Consi dered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROYAL PAIN rated close in the three path the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and improved through the far turn, dug in at the rail leaving the turn, got up mid-stretch and held off ONE NIGHT MIKE through the final sixteenth. The latter bobbled and made contact with Thunderinreadyrick leaving the gate then stalked toward the inside, picked up the chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, took the lead two deep nearing the quarter, raced clear midway on the far turn but was met mid-stretch and relented the final sixteenth. SPANGLISH settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole and raced in the three path of the far turn, though, flattened inside the eighth pole. NOBALLSTWOSTRIKES raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn in the three and four paths, left the turn outside and showed little more. PENGUIN PARADE saved ground off the pace, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but flattened at the rail on the far turn. THUNDERINREADYRICK was bumped then steadied leaving the gate but took the lead approaching the three quarter pole and rated the pace inside, came under pressure toward the five sixteenths, was met at the quarter and faded at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderinreadyrick
ENTRY.OWNER: Bass Tamera L Perry William M and Perry Susan D
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped,steadied start,rated pace,met 1/2,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Spanglish
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,cahsed 3/8,3p far turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Four Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRUZ IN THE CASTLE took a quick lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths pole, held the advantage at the rail on the far turn and dug in determinedly to hold off JACK'S LILLY, who stalked from the three path on the first turn and bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, contested the far turn off the rail, dug in from the head of the lane but missed the nod in a game finish. SWEET ANNABELLA stalked from the four path the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and came along to take third under the wire. DON'T TELL GRANDMA rated close inside, bid toward the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn near the rail, flattened stride later yards and was nipped from third under the wire. GOSSIPING rounded the opening turn off the rail, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole but flattened at the rail on the far turn. MY EXPENSIVE GIFT saved ground on the first turn, eased out leaving the turn and showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Don't Tell Grandma
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,bid 7/16,rail far turn,flattened late,nip 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Cruz in the Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured near 5/16,rail far turn,held on drvng

ENTRY.NAME: Gossiping
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,chased 7/16,flattened rail far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 82. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Januar y 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).

CLAIM.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Shake and Bake Racing LLC

RACE.FOOTNOTES: FREEDOM IS RINGING chased through the backstretch, raced in the four and five paths of the turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and edged clear the final yards. MATH MAN MARCO contested the pace from the start and took the nod past the three eighths pole, exchanged contact with Be Be Bop passing the five sixteenths pole, held the edge nearest the rail on the turn, but was met mid-stretch and relented the final yards. BLACK CANDY gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn and dug in through the stretch to hold third. FOREVER TAKES TIME gave chase through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn, angled to the outside leaving the turn and finished evenly while gaining on third. MAJESTIC SEAS dueled from the start and exchanged contact with BE BE BOP leaving the five sixteenths pole, contested at a close disadvantage on the turn then flattened toward mid-stretch. BE BE BOP dueled from the start but was jostled between horses leaving the five sixteenths pole, dropped back past the quarter, continued close through the turn but weakened leaving the eighth pole.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 22 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SISTER'S DUTY was forced slightly out and into Lectric Rod after the start then gave chase through the backstretch, closed to the front two deep midway on the turn and held on well with steady stretch handling. MO CO GOLD ducked out and exchanged contact with LADY SERENITY and was forced further upon that on a stride or two later, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and dueled through the stretch for second. The latter exchanged contact with Mo Co Gold leaving the gate then forced out and into Sister's Duty a stride or two later, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the six path and finished well to take third the final strides. LADY QUINN bore out and into Mo Co Gold leaving the gate then gave chase through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn, drifted toward the head of the lane and was nipped from third the final strides. CASTLE TOY drew clear at the half mile pole and angled to the inside to set the pace, was met at the rail midway on the turn then weakened inside the sixteenth pole. MANAGED MISCHIEF chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. LECTRIC ROD was brushed after the start, chased outside and rounded the turn in the five path.

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Quinn
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Mo Co Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Mammas Boys Thoroughbred Racing Group LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Serenity
ENTRY.OWNER: Gracie Mae Stables and Great Lake Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Sister's Duty
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed early,chased,up 2d mid turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Castle Toy
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear pace inside,met rail mid turn,weakened inside 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 39. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WARRIORINTHEHOUSE was hustled along with the early pace while tapering in, dueled clear at the quarter pole and was kept alert through the stretch. JUJU ON DA BEAT chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path of the turn and cleared second later yards. BANK CARD chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and relented second in later yards. PRETTY CASTLE steadied from early contention then picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the turn in the three path and passed rivals in the lane. LAURA'S GRAND chased through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. OK EMILY was unprepared for the start, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the stretch. SWISS HORIZON was pinched back at the rail nearing the seven sixteenths pole then gave chase through the backstretch and raced at the rail on the turn. GATTOLOTTASPARKLE gave chase and rounded the turn in the six path. BOWMANS LAZY GIRL was forced in nearing the seven sixteenths pole then pressured the pace, but dropped back at the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. The Stewards reviewed, then dismissed claims of foul against the riders of Warriorinthehouse, for alleged interference nearing the seven sixteenths pole, and against the rider of Pretty Castle for alleged interference into the turn, lodged by the rider of Swiss Horizon.

ENTRY.NAME: Bowmans Lazy Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced in early,pressed pace,dropped back 1/4,rail turn,weakened

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Jack L. Harper & Jane Anderson Harper

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Rac e Since December 22 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOE TAPPIN LUKE drifted into the first turn and stalked through the turn, took the edge toward the three eighths pole and dueled at mostly even terms from that point, edged clear midway on the far turn and was steadily handled to hold on. ROYAL THUNDER raced two deep on the first turn and gave chase into the backstretch, steadily closed toward contention, rounded the turn in the three path and dug in under steady encouragement to finish well at the outside poll of the winner. CLOSE THE CASE settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn off the rail, angled to the outside leaving the turn and finished evenly to take third mid-stretch. MISSIONSNINETYNINE was carried out into the first turn then stalked about the four path through the turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and flattened in the lane. CHARLIE POTATOES saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, closed to the heels of BUTTONED UP at the rail approaching the eighth pole, came around that one leaving the turn but showed little more. BUTTONED UP set the early pace inside, was met and gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn and weakened in the lane. REMEMBERING WILBUR saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole but showed no response and was eased the final quarter mile. FRIENDLY FELLA was pulled up with a fatal injury shortly after the start and was euthanized on the track.

ENTRY.NAME: Charlie Potatoes
ENTRY.OWNER: Knapp Richard M and Brafman Larry N

ENTRY.NAME: Friendly Fella
ENTRY.OWNER: Stevark Stable Inc and Rentz Randy

ENTRY.NAME: Buttoned Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead inside,met 3/8,chased,dropped back rail turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Close the Case
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,off rail far turn,angled out 1/8,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Missionsninetynine
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Cefalu John

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOT FLOFFY accelerated to the lead toward the seven sixteenths pole and rated the early pace, was pressured leaving the three eighths, contested the edge at the rail on the turn and held on well under steady stretch encouragement. FIT BUT FAT was bumped outward and into Adios See Ya leaving the gate then pressured the pace from the three eighths pole, raced close off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. BAYTOWN JAKESTER came out and exchanged contact with Forever The Boss leaving the gate and was kept in check off the heels of Dinner Bell through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. POLITICAL DECISION bore in and made contact with Billingsgate on the chute then gave chase, raced two deep on the turn, was carried out into the lane but finished evenly. BILLINGSGATE was bumped then came in and made contact with Baytown Jakester on the chute and settled off the early pace, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced in the seven path of the turn and ran widest through the lane. DINNER BELL came out at the start and made contact with Baytown Jakester on the chute, gave chase inside, raced off the rail on the turn, eased out leaving the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. ABOUT TO RAGE ducked out and hit the gate at the start, made light contact with Fit But Fat then pressured the pace, but dropped back nearing the quarter pole and faded while losing ground on the turn. FOREVER THE BOSS was forced in and into Baytown Jakester then picked back on the chute. VIDMER'S COURAGE was pinched back at the start and never factored. ADIOS SEE YA was bumped leaving the gate then chased outside, weakened leaving the five sixteenths pole and raced in the six path of the turn. ORIGINALLY HAND-TIMED, TIMES CHANGED UPON REVIEW.

ENTRY.NAME: Dinner Bell
ENTRY.COMMENT: came out,bumped chute,chased inside,off rail turn,flattened 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Baytown Jakester
ENTRY.COMMENT: came out,bumped break,kept in check,rail turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Billingsgate
ENTRY.OWNER: Pepe Stable and J L M Jacona Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped,came in chute,chased 3/8,7p turn,even finish outside

ENTRY.NAME: Political Decision
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore in,bumped chute,chased,2d turn,carried out 1/8,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Got Floffy
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 7/16,set pressured pace,edge rail turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: About to Rage
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out,hit gate break,pressed pace,faded losing ground turn
